events.name: Docker Birthday #4 Celebration
events.description: https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/m5u7_PEzssv27lj50cGL5A78hDpq2PHioRuYWdMoJaMiVrrclf05ntT9g9rJm01zJMdQE57HgRP3are0U0HVIyuTljFXFj5llfBeGRHWPXH2VT5-xr7ts7cUsuMiE8YIVgq_RHoR Join us in celebrating the Docker Project‚Äôs 4th birthday! To celebrate together and warmly welcome newcomers into our community, we will provide Docker labs and courses to learn about Docker in a fun and inviting way. Are you an advanced user? We strongly encourage Docker users of all skill levels to attend! We need a network of mentors who understand the Docker platform to answer any questions that attendees working through the courses and labs may have. We also have some fun projects you can work on. Click here to sign up as a mentor. Agenda:18h30 - Doors Open18h45 - Welcome message, presentation of Docker & snacks19h - 21h30 - Working session21h30 - Cake and Socializing! As we get closer to the event, we will share more information including materials on how to prepare for the courses and labs that will be available.
events.location: NUS-ISS auditorium, 25 Heng Mui Keng terrace, 119615, Singapore

events.name: Cybersecurity - Trends, Opportunities & Careers!
events.description:
CYBERGATE INSTITUTE will be conducting a talk on Cybersecurity - Trends, Opportunities & Careers!¬†
Join us at SAFRA Mount Faber on 15th¬†March 2017 (Wed) at¬†6:30pm. Free admission for all.
Highlights of the talk will be on

The right certification to join this growing workforce (e.g CISSP)

What's more.....¬†
SAFRA members get to enjoy 15% rebates off the CISSP course registrations!
events.location: SAFRA Mount Faber, 2 Telok Blangah Way, Singapore 098803
events.group_name: CYBERGATE INSTITUTE - A collaboration between Training Vision Institute & National Cybersecurity Institute,USA

events.name: How NoSQL powers the Operational Data Hub
events.description:
Our kickoff event, hosted by Women in Tech, will feature an art of the possible discussion on Operational Data Hubs and how they help break down the traditional barriers between legacy data warehouses and operational systems that run the business.¬† ¬†Find out how NoSQL technology can discover new insights in your operational data and turn them into actionable information. 


Agenda: 6:30pm - Networking and refreshments 7:00pm - Ken Krupa speaking on NoSQL and Operational Data Hubs 7:45pm - Q&A, Discussion on further Meetups
events.location: Collision 8, 1 North Bridge Road, 8th Floor, Singapore

events.name: Visual Studio 2017 launch
events.description: Visual Studio 2017 is launching on the 7th March! As we celebrate 20 years of Visual Studio, join us as share the latest innovations with Visual Studio 2017. This meetup will be the first of multiple sessions to cover the breadth and depth of new features coming in Visual Studio 2017 and Visual Studio Team Services. Session 1: Visual Studio Team Services - Mobile work item (preview) The preview of the mobile work item form in Visual Studio Team Services is finally here! This preview optimizes the look and feel of your work items on your mobile devices and supports mobile-friendly controls to make your experience modern and intuitive. Join me in a conversation where we can share with our plan for our upcoming sprints, do a quick demo, and discuss other scenarios that are important when you‚Äôre on the go. Speaker: Jose Rady Allende, Program Manager,¬†Microsoft (Jose will be delivering his talk over Skype as he is not based in Singapore) Session 2: What's new with Visual Studio 2017.¬† We'll share through technical demos to help you get the most out of Visual Studio 2017 Speaker: Riza, Microsoft technology enthusiast
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, Level 22, Room CF12, One Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018989

events.name: Singapore Rustaceans Meetup #2
events.description: Hey everyone, this month we have Noritada Shimizu from Mozilla Japan to conduct a Rust workshop! üëè It will be totally hands-on and if you're trying to learn Rust and you are new to the language, this workshop is for you! Here's what he will cover on that day: ‚Ä¢ Rust fundamentals: basic syntax, value ownership and borrowing ‚Ä¢¬† Create your own UNIX "cat" command ‚Ä¢¬†Strings ‚Ä¢¬† File I/O ‚Ä¢¬†Error handling with the Result type So do bring along your laptops if you want to follow along. As usual, pizzas will be served 30 minutes before the meetup. Do come at 630pm to talk to other Rust programmers in Singapore. Food and venue sponsor:
events.location: Singapore Power, 240 Tanjong Pagar Road #08-00 Singapore 088540

events.name: TechLadies Study CS50 - Week 2
events.description:
Join us in this women-only study group to learn computer science! While there will be one or two mentors to help all of us out, you need to be self-reliant as much as possible as this is not a workshop. 

In this study group, we are taking the course, HarvardX: CS50 Introduction to Computer Science, on edX together. üë©üèª‚Äçüíª üí™

To join in this study group, please:

1. Create an account on edX and enroll into the course at this link: https://courses.edx.org/courses/course-v1:HarvardX+CS50+X/info

2. Watch the week 2 lecture video before this session

We will be working on Problem Set 2 when we meet on Wed: http://docs.cs50.net/2017/x/psets/2/pset2.html

Bring your fully charged laptop and we'll see you soon!

Note: Please buy something at the cafe as we're merely crashing that cafe. We don't want to be kicked out!

Psst! This study group is for women only. :)
events.location: Jewel Coffee at Tanjong Pagar Centre, 7 Wallich Street #B1-06 Tanjong Pagar Centre, Singapore 078884

events.name: DataLearn - Docker for reproducible research
events.description: We're holding a DataLearn on how to use docker within a data project! What is this DataLearn?This DataLearn is to prepare volunteers for our upcoming DataDive (to be held on 7-9 Apr). In this session, we will share on the usage of dockerized jupyter notebooks for R and Python. This is to ensure volunteers know how to use these tools at the DataDive. Using docker will allow us to promote reproducibility of analysis among project team members and our partner organisations, regardless of our computing environments (Windows, Linux or MacOS). Please bring your laptop as this will be a hands-on session, thanks!
events.location: ThoughtWorks , 18 cross street #11-08 China Sq Central (S)048423, Singapore
